greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the expected number of returns to the origin of a random walk on a 4-d lattice.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.9 Polya's random walk constants, p. 323.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pólya's Random Walk Constants.
formula: m(d) = d/(2*Pi)^d*multipleIntegral(-Pi..Pi) (d-sum_(k=1..d) cos(t_k))^(-1) dt_1 dt_2 ... dt_d, where d is the lattice dimension.
m(d) = integral_(t>0) exp(-t)*BesselI(0,t/d)^d dt where BesselI(0,x) is the zeroth modified Bessel function.
maple: map(parse, subs("."=NULL, [seq(i, i=s)]))[]; # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 23 2014
mathematica: digits = 50; NIntegrate[BesselI[0, t/4]^4*Exp[-t], {t, 0, Infinity}, PrecisionGoal -> digits, WorkingPrecision -> 350] // RealDigits [#, 10, digits]& // First (* after _Ryan Propper_ *)
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, May 23 2014
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, May 23 2014
